intro: Daucus toriloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved carrot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many familiar edible plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Daucus toriloides is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
